newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Kembla Coal sells mine to Austral.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Kembla Coal sells mine to Austral.

text.p: CRA Ltd subsidiary Kembla Coal & Coke Pty Ltd (KCC) said on Wednesday it had agreed to sell its Tahmoor coking coal mine to Austral Coal NL.
The sale, for an undisclosed sum, was expected to be completed in February 1997.
Kembla, which sold its Illawarra coke company to ICC Holdings Pty Ltd in February, has been seeking buyers for the Tahamoor and West Cliff underground mines in New South Wales.
Japanese steel mills had been major consumers of Tahmoor's high quality coking coal, and the mine has been operating profitably, it said.
Tahmoor produced 1.5 million tonnes of saleable coal in the year to November 30, 1996.
Austral Coal is a subsidiary of unlisted Perth-based company Resource Equities.
Kembla said it was currently negotiating the sale of the West Cliff mine.
